section.title: Description
section.para: Use this view to enter pattern data. Since Neil is a so-called tracker, you have to enter notes in a certain quite peculiar format. Time in trackers go from top to bottom. Each line in this view is a musical event. Columns are used to enter data which are always integral numbers displayed in hexadecimal. These numbers can be used to set synthesizer parameters, note values and other performance data.

section.title: Navigating with keyboard
section.para: For those of you who prefer using keyboard to using mouse (this is probably everyone when shown how). Apart from moving the cursor with arrow keys there are ways to change the active machine, pattern, wave, step, octave and to make selections in the pattern editor. To change the active machine use Ctrl + Up and Ctrl + Down shortcut. To change the active pattern use "+" and "-" keys on the numeric keypad if your are on a laptop use the key kombination that emulates numeric keypad. Plus key increases active pattern number while the minus key decreases it. To change the active wave you can use the "<" and ">" keys. Use the "*" and "/" keys on the numpad to change the active octave up and down one octave. Use the "[" and "]" keys to change the step size for the editor.
